result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shane Michael Segner

records.addlTxt:
2:41 PM Defendant Shane Michael Segner in court.  Attorney Amber Day Lucsay in court for Shane Michael Segner.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. The defendant wishes to waive his right to the preliminary hearing. DA Nolen and Atty Lucsay states they have come to a joint agreement. Court finds probable cause. Defendant bound over for trial. Information filed. Atty Lucsay waived the formal reading on the information. The defendant wishes to enter plea of not guilty on all counts. Matter set over. Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant waived his right to have his preliminary hearing within the statutory time limits.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 11:44 AM Defendant Shane Michael Segner in court, in custody.  Attorney Amber Day Lucsay appeared via zoom.  Attorney Craig Nolen in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waived time limits for the preliminary hearing. Matter previously scheduled for preliminary hearing. Victim wishes to speak in regards to the bond. Bond to be modified to no violent or abusive contact wit the victim E.B.

AMENDED: 
Violation - DC 2cts; Battery; Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.  Issuing Agency - GCSD.
NO CONTACT WITH: E.B. or her residence, the defendant and the victim E.B are allowed phone contact only,  No violent or abusive or disorderly contact with: E.B. via text to arrange placement re: minor children.  May not possess or consume any intoxicants. May not enter establishments (to include bars, taverns, or other premises) whose primary purpose is the sale of intoxicants with the exception of gas stations and grocery stores.  May enter gas stations and grocery stores but may not go into the area where intoxicants are sold. May go to the residence one time to pick up personal belongings if accompanied by an officer.

The State is opposed to modifying the existing bond at this time. Matter set over.
